intro: Ilex steyermarkii, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, red berries. The plant is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in well-drained soils. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive appearance. The leaves are usually alternate and have a leathery texture, contributing to its hardy nature.
